campaign.story:
Hello, All.
Over a year ago I launched an unsuccessful Kickstarter campaign. That project was to print a similar deck of cards on plastic stock. The project ultimately failed to get funding, but provided me with a good amount of feedback about the design. I am happy to say that this time around I will be offering my new design on paper stock for all of the cardists, magicians, enthusiasts and my intended market on the first go - the poker players. I originally designed this deck to be a promotional item to be sold in the pro shop of my future pool hall where poker players were my main market. I tried to make this design work for everyone this time, so I ditched the plastic by popular demand. I will be having these decks printed by the USPCC with the embossed finish to better suit all of my markets for this deck
About this Deck
Small. I know. I will post a better picture soon.
Your Court Cards:

I tried to keep this playing card design clean with crisp lines and simple graphics. There is a hint of a pool table border on each card to tie them all together around that theme. The corner pips are laid out in sort of an abstract crop of a striped pool ball (you will see this better in the images below). On this revised design, as in the previous one all of the court/face cards which were holding swords are holding darts or have a dart inspired background. All of the court/face cards which were holding staffs or rod-like weapons are holding pool cues or have a pool rack inspired background. I have a short, fictional back-story for each of the court card designs which helped inspire me to create them. I will post a comment with these back-stories for backers of this project to read.
The following are digital mock-ups of the Court Cards (numbered cards and the tuck box images are coming). I tried to keep these as true to regular playing cards as possible in terms of typical slang and poker usage. Such as, all one eyed cards (3) are in profile, while all others are facing the viewer; Man with the Axe is now the Man with the Racks; Suicide King is mocking a gun to his head and is standing in front of the dartboard, Chick with a Stick is holding a pool cue, etc. I even went as far as making sure the correct Kings and Jacks have mustaches because I played a game once where the dealer dealt a game called No-Mo Wild, which meant all men without mustaches are wild (I think Aussies and Brits call mustaches Mo's). These cards should be able to play in most any game, using any slang you are used to.
The Jokers & Reveal
I am not a magician, cardist or playing card collector/enthusiast. I designed the jokers basically because I had to (I have a back story for her too) and I added a reveal card because I stil had two spaces left on my sheet. I mention the above because I am not quite sure what a reveal card is used for. I am assuming it is a clever way to reveal a specific card that a person has chosen without it actually being that card. If I am incorrect please excuse my ignorance in this regard. I just play cards and pretend the jokers don't exist. But because I had to come up with one or two, or 4 I decided to add the reveal card and I put my own spin on it. If this card is not going to work for the magicians and cardists, then I have decided to print the back stories of the court cards  on the two cards I have left. If it does work for you guys, then I need to know what I can do with the one remaining card I have not yet designed for. In any case here are what your Jokers look like. The reveal card is 3H. If you have any input on having 3 jokers as opposed to two please send a message or a comment. I have heard from both camps so far and it is fairly divided at this point.
The Pips
There was concern on my last design that the pips may not be easily distinguishable at a distance. I've created a new set of pips which I've tested at the extremity of my own and others' eyesight to ensure that each pip is recognizable and will not likely be confused for another. Even when printed in the same color or when knocking out of the same color, each of the pips was easily recognizable.
Corner Pips and Interior Pips
Other design tweaks here and there have brought me to the design I am offering you guys today. I hope you like the new design and I hope you will back this project to get my first deck of playing cards to print. Not only that, but hopefully to get Phil Pockets going as an online business while I wait out the opportunity to open some doors on a physical space to put that name on.
The Tuck Box
I have redesigned my tuck box which had not posted at launch. I originally intended to put the tuck inside the two-piece box, but have since decided to drop the slide-top box due to lack of interest and cost. It is a simple tuck design. On the back of the box I have decided to thank you all for your support. This is where I redesigned. I have decided to thank three of you by name on the back of the card and the rest of you in number. I will offer 3 rewards, each to have your name printed on this box. I wanted to keep this fair and not throw it out there only for the higher tier backers. To do this I will post all of the three new reward tiers on or around 10 PM EST, Thursday, August 1st, 2013. There will be a $50, $100 and $150 reward to have your name added to the back of the box. I wanted to give everyone a fair chance at getting in on this and this was the only way I figured I could do so. It will also be a 2 deck reward. So if you want to get your name on the tuck box save the date 10 PM EST, Thursday, August 1st, 2013 and act fast. It will be first come - first served. Good luck.
The Rewards
The rewards I am offering are basic, just as the design of these cards are. I don't have a lot of time or money at this point to build from scratch or to work with vendors or manufacturers to offer you the kinds of things I want to for this project. If things go well with this project then you will see future projects from me and these other rewards will come to be in due time. For now I will offer what I know I can produce at a quality I would be proud to own myself. I am a hands-on kind of person, so if do not have first hand knowledge of the quality of a product I will not offer it. This being said, although my rewards may be less glamorous than other similar projects, you can be sure the quality is there and I will stand behind those products. They are representing myself and my future business and I will not settle for sub-par. I am also in no way saying that other similar projects are offering sub-par rewards. I am just saying I do not have any first hand experience with these products so I will not risk my future business' name on it.
Stretch Goals and Add-ons
I would like to print this deck in black first and if we reach our first stretch goal of $20,000 I would like to print a gold deck with it. Any multi-deck rewards will be split (half black and half gold decks) if the first stretch goal is reached. If we are not able to print the gold decks all multi-deck rewards will be multiple black decks. So, if you want two colors, get the word out to anyone you think can help us reach the goal.
The Thank You Chips - at $23,000
This is the Thank You Set of casino quality poker chips I would like to offer as the $23,000 stretch goal after the Gold Deck. If we reach our goal for the Thank You Chips I will include one (1) set of each of the five (5) chips you see here. One member of each family and the Joker have been selected to offer their thanks and mine for making this project happen. These will be produced in the exact quantity required to honor this goal and only for the backers of this project if we hit the goal amount.
Digital Mock-up of the Poker Chips for the Player Reward and Add-ons
These casino quality poker chips will be available as an Add-on for $10 for each sample set (6 chips - one of each denomination). There will also be a couple of chances to own full 500 piece poker sets of these chips in the Poker Player Rewards. I also have other rewards such as the Collector Rewards which offer 150 piece sets (25 of each denomination) with 2 decks of cards.
These ceramic poker chips are truly Casino Quality Chips. I have them produced by a manufacturer who produces the same quality chips for casinos all over the world. They use the same material and processes to make my chips as they do to make the casino chips so these are not cheap plastic chips with poor printing or cheap stickers. These graphics will not come off even after years of regular play (this I know from experience). The graphics are a part of the chip and these chips are quality. You will realize this when you have them in your hand. 
I haven't decided on any other stretch goals yet because I do not want to be presumptuous. I will deal with new stretch goals as the current one approaches its goal. I am open to suggestions as well. I have a not-so-unique idea for another add-on. It's a t-shirt set. I have it designed, but they may not work for all and may only be suitable for the poker-friendly with the right (or wrong) sense of humor. If you would like to see them I may be able to post them in the comments section later.
Beyond fulfilling the pledge awards here, any additional money raised from this campaign will go toward creating a brand and business of Phil Pockets' Billiards and Games which will offer new card designs and more. Ultimately I would like to bring you furniture, custom cases for all types of uses and custom accessories for billiards, poker, darts and game rooms in general. You guys are the key to making this happen and I appreciate any help you can offer.
About Phil Pockets' Theatre of Misspent Youth
Back in the day you could walk into any pool hall and get a money game going easily. It could be any game from darts to poker and obviously pool or billiards. You didn't enter into those games lightly or green. If you did you learned your lesson quickly. Instead you would play on your own. You'd practice. You'd enter tournaments. You'd learn offense and defense. You'd gamble with your friends only. You'd build relationships and learn from the people better than you. You'd lose. You'd learn to play the person as well as the game. In time you would evolve into that player who can comfortably and confidently walk into any pool hall and get a money game going. You just had to bring some cash and your game. And from behind the counter, the owners sit and watch these people grow from naive kids into the player's players. It's almost like watching a home movie to most of them. This is their balcony seat in the Theatre of Misspent Youth.
Phil Pockets' is to be the name of my future pool hall and gaming center. I envisioned it as a personal game room that was to be right down the road, instead of in your own home where you would have to clean up after yourself and your inconsiderate friends. It was to have pool tables, dart alleys and all kinds of gear and tech you would love to have in your own personal game room. The old logo (above) incorporates a shark mascot. His name, as you can guess is Phil Pockets.
In the past decade or so it seems pool halls have been dying off and closing their doors due to the lack of popularity that these establishments once carried. It is sad to me. I love pool halls. I started playing pool at an early age and fell in love with it. I am a fan of physics (not school book physics, but practical physics). Pool, 3-cusion billiards, snooker and all other billiard games are all about physics and you get to see it in action with immediate feedback, which is a thrill to me. Ever since the age of 16 or when I started playing in tournaments and in leagues I dreamed of opening a pool hall.
Because pool halls (in the States) are closing their doors at a rapid pace these days I have had to put my dream on hold. The pool hall I envision is unprofitable at the moment. For that reason I have decided to open Phil Pockets' in the digital realm and offer custom billiards, darts, poker and other game room accessories and furniture. All are elements which I designed for my pool hall. I have many of these products actually produced (one-offs right now), but without the proper equipment and workspace I cannot produce any of them to meet even a small consumer demand. I am hoping to use this Kickstarter project to help me launch other Kickstarter projects which may bring all of my Phil Pockets' products to life. Maybe by doing this Phil Pockets' Theatre of Misspent Youth can become a reality. If not in the original, intended pool hall sense then maybe by living in individual homes instead.
Thank you, Kickstarters.
Chuck
I will post updates and comments as regularly as I can.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As this is potentially my first project to reach its goal I am sure I will run into issues that I have not planned for or foreseen. Please know that I will do everything I can to make sure you are completely satisfied with your pledge reward. If your reward is not exactly what you pledged for please allow me the opportunity to correct it. I'm sure there are some growing pains to get through, but I hope they are minimal and I hope that you will bear with me through any. Thanks.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Kickstarters.
Tonight is the night I put this campaign to rest (unless I fall asleep first). Again I apologize for pulling the plug early, but I think it is for the best. I hope you all understand that I want this project to be a success for everyone. The timely delivery of the backer rewards is my only concern about this current project and why I have chosen to retire it.
I will relaunch again (re-re-launch?) in the near future with much nicer rewards (hand-made by yours truly), a funding goal that I am confident in and all of the same passion I continue to have for this project.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank You to all supporters of this design
updates.update_content:
Hi, Kickstarters.
Well, it seems this project has gathered as much steam as it is going to, so I'm going to have to pull the plug on it. I may give it another day or so, but I will likely be shutting it down by the weekend.
At the start of this project I received a few emails from backers stating that my funding goal was not high enough and that I would not make it to the break-even point at 8K. They suggested that I cancel it early and start over. I figured I would just see what kind of interest was out there first. I made a promise to myself that if I wasn't at 100% funded by the halfway point that I would pull the plug then. The halfway point is tomorrow and I'm still a far cry from funded with little prospect for getting there in time.

campaign.story:
First of all, I would like to apologize for the video in advance.  I didn't have enough resources to make a professional video.  All of my capital available went to patent, research, prototypes, and manufacturer.  Thank you.
Why changing the concept of a cap?
The regular baseball caps were design around the 1900's with the purpose of covering the players eyes from the sun.  Today people use them for style mostly.  The engineering of the baseball cap has many flaws since it doesn't completely covers the sensitive skin area around the eyes. also the material and shape of the whole hat does not provide proper sun deflection and protection. It rather does the opposite.
Regular baseball cap
As you can see above the brim of the hat is about 6 inches wide, and 3 inches long. leaving the sides of your eyes exposed to the sun.  The part that covers your head, which is called the crown, has a "pot" shape which leaves space between your head and the crown.  Air concentrates in that space turning into moisture.  And water usually magnifies the effects of temperature both hot or cold.  These hats are usually made out of acrylic, and this material does not help you keeping cool, or warm.
Is ArmorHat only for hot temperatures?
ArmorHat will come in 2 different models:
Deflect : For hot conditions, helps you keep cool
Absorb: For cold conditions.  Helps you stay dry and warm
What are the materials used in ArmorHat?
ArmorHat is 100% soft polyester which is permeable, allowing moisture build by the heat or cold to evaporate out of your head, plus blocking moisture to come back in.  The material used for the "Absorb" model will be a thicker polyester.
What are the deflectors?
The deflectors are fabrics that are located in a specific way inside, and around the hat that helps deflect the sun rays to other directions.  The more sun light is being deflected from your head, the less warmer you will feel.
The deflectors on top of the head will always be white.  Why white?  Because white color is the only color that does not absorb the sunlight, it bounces everything away.  That is the reason why we feel cooler when we wear white color t- shirts rather than wearing a black color t-shirt, because black color absorbs all of the sun spectrum.  Nothing bounces back, that is why we see the color black.
For the "Absorb" model, you will notice that it wont have white deflectors on top.  Instead it will have black strips (absorbers) to absorb the sun rays to help keep you warm, but also dry, and not allowing the radiation in.  The radiation is what basically burns our skin. 
Why is the bottom part of the brim in black color?
Is black because not only the sun rays that come from above burns us.  We are also being hit by the sun rays that are being deflected from the objects around us, specially when it snows, all the sun rays that are being deflected from the white snow, bounces back to our face.  Since black absorbs the sunlight, it will help absorb most of the deflected sun rays that are being bounce towards you from other objects.
What is the "Dua layr?
The "Dua layr" are 2 extra layers made of polyester that that are positioned in a way that also helps you deflect or absorb the sun light depending of the model.  The most important function of these layers is to keep your head dry.  Remember that moist raises the intensity of cold or heat.
What is the field of view?
The field of view is the extent of what we see at any given moment.  We have an almost 180-degree forward-facing horizontal field of view.  Regular brims block our field of view by 20%
field of view with regular brim
Armor hat only blocks our field of view by less than 10%
field of view with ArmorHat
Important:  ArmorHat will be available with both types of brim.  The V-shape brim tech, and the classic baseball cap brim.  You choose.
How much ArmorHat weight?
ArmorHat is ultralight.  It weights merely 61 grams.  A regular cap weights around 118 grams.
What are the available colors and sizes?
Remember that the color of the deflectors or absorbers will not change in color.  The available colors will be 
Black
White
Blue (as shown on prototypes)
Red
Green
Pink
The available sizes are standard for adults and children over 10 years old.  It will come with an adjustable band.  For children under 10.  I will be needing the age of the child for the proper size.
Why Only $3,000 dollars?
Compared to other kickstart projects that ask for far more money, I only ask for this amount because I already spent most of my money in patents, design, prototypes, and locating a manufacturer.  I just need this last step.

campaign.story:
Thank you for taking the time to look at our most recent custom playing card project! Deco designed as a matched pair and is a limited production. Only 2,500 sets will be printed. We encourage you to pledge today!
Background:
Encarded's first two decks, Tendril and Aurum, explored a variety of new ideas in playing card design. Shadow borders, face patterns that are more than just texture, organic symmetry, purposeful imperfections, custom die cuts, laser cutting. Some of those features still don't exist on any other custom deck. Since each deck we design is nothing like the one before, we once again will take a 180 degree turn and the next deck from Encarded is simpler at first glance, but to those people that appreciate the finer things it's a Bicycle deck like you've never seen before.
Deco aims to tap into the mystique of casino-style decks of the past, with their boldly simple design, but bring the exceptional modern handling and finishes to the forefront. Deco also wanted to be visually simple from a distance but packed with subtle detail up close. All of this is packaged into a fully custom deck that is still familiar and perfectly playable, like all Bicycle decks.
Deco Proof Sheets
Deco Silver
Deco Bronze
Deco Silver and Bronze
Card Details:
Deco will be a limited 5,000 deck production by the US Playing Card Company. They will be sold in a pair, 2,500 sets total. It will not be reprinted or released again. Most major deck releases are printed in the tens of thousands, so Deco will be a guaranteed rarity from the start.
The cards will be on the highest-end Bee Casino stock with the excellent Magic finish. They will handle at the supreme top-end of the playing card scale. When you bring these out at your next poker game all your friends will notice how great they shuffle.
Deco Silver will be the light deck, with metallic silver, rich blue and white tones. Deco Bronze will be the dark deck, with warm near-black colors, metallic red and metallic bronze.
Deco has unique 90-degree four corner pips, carefully designed to assist with identifying cards when playing card games as well as adding visual detail during card flourishing or magic.
Deco will feature many elegant, hand-crafted details. Metallic inks add shimmer and depth and the deck is housed in a beautiful foil and embossed tuck box. 
After this Kickstarter, Deco will be released in the Encarded store. You will get your decks first and at a better price by pledging today!


Deco "Personal Edition" Collector Deck
KICKSTARTER SPECIAL. This will be your first chance to get a completely unique playing card collectible. 
Until now, a personalized deck has meant the designer scribbled your name on it with a pen. Encarded takes it to the next level by precision-cutting your initials directly into the special tuck box, infusing your identity into the box like never before. Peeking through these cut outs will reveal design features not visible in the standard sealed deck.
View Larger
We will create a custom, precision-cut USPCC tuck box in a beautiful black linen paper which is overprinted with a subtle deco pattern. The front of the box has a carefully designed cut-out that frames the main back design, and the back of the box will feature YOUR INITIALS (up to 3 characters) precision cut from the box. As you can see in the prototype above, Paul has cut out "PDC" for himself.
The elegant black linen box can have either Deco color in it. For maximum contrast, select the silver deck. For a subtle and stealthy look, select a Bronze deck. You will be able to choose your color in the survey.
The deck will be signed on the bottom, cellophaned and sealed with the Encarded holographic seal (and Paul will write your initials on the seal). Note that since these are a hand-crafted personalized item, they will take a little extra time to produce after the Kickstarter is complete.
Add-On's
We have a couple add-on items: an Encarded decal sticker (2" diameter), and a limited-edition matching collectors coin. 
The coin will be done in antique silver, with a very detailed design unique to each side and a ridged edge like US currency. The coin will be 1.5" in diameter so it will be the size and weight of a normal US Silver Dollar. The coin will add a custom touch as a poker dealer button or in coin magic. The image here is a digital render, so the final product will vary. We will only be making a few hundred of these, so get yours now. They may not be available in the Encarded store after this Kickstarter. 
Coin - Add $10 each to your pledge
Sticker - Get two stickers for $1
Design Influences:
When looking at design styles, themes and art movements to use as inspiration for this deck, the Art Deco movement of the early part of the 20th century was our first choice. We've always loved the style; simple and bold yet mixed with lovely intricacy in certain places. We started looking around and found a variety of inspiration that started to form the basis for our ideas for the deck.
We knew that the back design would be much simpler than our previous decks. We wanted to create a strong shape, and since we live in Florida we turned to the art deco style found in Miami. The primary shape of the back design is evocative of a palm tree, which is another of our favorite features in the area we live.
While we wanted this deck to be purposefully simpler, the design will also work in texture and detail that you can appreciate upon closer inspection. From a distance the cards appear simple and bold, but we felt there was no reason that up close, in the hand, you couldn't also have richness and elegance.
If you'd like to read some more detail on the design process and thinking behind Deco, please check out the preview blog on our site.
The solid appearance at a distance turns into intricate detail up close
Rewards:
We are keeping things very simple on Kickstarter this time around. If you want to make sure you get some of these cards and get free or reduced shipping costs then now is the time to pledge.
Deco is designed and sold as a matched pair, 1 Silver and 1 Bronze deck and only 2,500 pairs will be printed. To preserve the final production number, the campaign rewards are all limited in number.  US Shipping is built into the reward costs and international shipping is as reasonable as we can make it. We've shipped over 2,200 orders all over the world and have our process quite streamlined.
To keep the entire process efficient and get your decks to you as soon as possible after production is complete, we won't do any "one-off" customizations of the reward packages. However, if you want to pledge for multiple rewards, please add the values together and we will provide the opportunity to tell us which packages you claimed during the survey. Please note that the Early bird reward package is intended for those people that only want a single pair and get one in time. Just message us if you have questions.
Example: You want a very limited Personal Edition reward and a $40 two pair reward. Select the most limited reward as your selection (Personal edition - $95) but make your total pledge amount $135. 
And of course, if you need something else to make your collection complete, Deco will be available at Encarded.com and select resellers after this campaign.
Thanks again for checking out our latest project!
Paul Carpenter, Encarded
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are very few risks in funding this project. Deco is already close to production with the US Playing Card Company. The low goal for this campaign is set to ensure that everyone on Kickstarter can get their decks. This is our third major deck project and our previous decks were delivered before the deadlines. After the Kickstarter you can also order from our website at http://encarded.com
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Add Two New Encarded Decks to Your Collection!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
The very first Encarded deck, Tendril, has TWO new sequels that are currently on Kickstarter. Backers like you were instrumental in making Tendril a reality in 2012, and you've also helped fuel the playing card revolution on Kickstarter. 
The original Tendril deck is nearly impossible to find, as collectors have been holding onto them for years now. These two new decks, called Ascendant and Nightfall will be amazing additions to your Encarded collection, so check out the new project!
As with all Encarded productions, we'll only be printing these decks one time and Kickstarter will be your best (and possibly only) chance to get some of these great new collector decks!

Hi,
This will probably be the last official update for the Deco project. Most people have gotten their decks but there are still a small percentage of international backers still waiting on their packages. Hopefully your respective mail services and customs get them through their systems soon!
For the few of you that had damaged goods, I will be taking care of you. I have a list of all the various issues and I will be correcting those once all the backers have their initial mailing. I know how disappointing it is to get decks that have been mishandled and I'll do what I can to make it right on a case-by-case basis.

Hello Deco Backers,
The majority of you should have your decks, or they should be very close to arriving if you are an international shipment. I've heard from a few people about issues with their shipments and next week I will be taking care of those handful of folks that had severe damage due to rough handling by our wonderful worldwide postal services. :(
If you'e contacted my in the last few weeks about an issue I will be preparing items for you soon. Someday, when teleportation is a reality we won't have to discuss things like this, but for the moment I'll do my best to make sure you get nice cards.

The US Postal Service is picking up the last remaining Deco packages tomorrow morning, November 15th. With the exception of just a handful of "oddballs" all of the Deco rewards have been shipped. If you don't have yours yet, it is on the way and you should see it soon.
Adding up the Kickstarter rewards, the Encarded.com preorders and the decks that went to resellers, it looks like we have only a hundred or so pairs of Deco left. If you've been debating getting some, I'd act quickly as this deck is soon going to be fully sold out.

updates.update_userinfo: The final 40. Deco is nearly gone!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
Well this shipping period has been hectic, split up with all kinds of travel and other things, but there are only about 40 packages left and I am aiming to have those out the door in the next day or so. The final reward tier is the one that took the most time to assemble: the collector bundle of the signed, sealed and numbered decks. I apologize for the delay, but no matter how you cut it, it takes a lot of time to sign things (in two different inks, of course, since I like to make things coordinate) and get all those numbers and seals on things.

Hi everyone!
I just wanted to send a quick note that we've got the bulk of the rewards on their way already. We currently have about 100 or so orders still to package, mainly the "tricky" things like uncut sheets, items with signatures and seals or pledges where people customized and added on various items. 
I'm working diligently to get everything on the way as rapidly as possible, and expect to get everything wrapped up in the next few days here. I have some additional shipping materials arriving today and will be getting more decks into their packages. If you haven't gotten your package yet, be assured that it's on the way or will be very soon!

Hi all,
Deco is on its way out and shipments will continue for the next week or so. We filled the back of the Postal truck yesterday and have many more in the queue. I know everyone is keen on getting their decks, so we'll be doing all we can to move the process along quickly and get this wrapped up soon!
Thanks,

Hi everyone,
Now that I am back from Vegas (after spending almost a week surrounded by serious card collectors and enthusiasts) shipments of Deco will start going out. We have hundreds of packages in the queue and will be getting postage on them and sending them out starting in the next few days. 
The decks look great and even collectors that only bought rare decks made before 1850 seemed to think Deco was well done, so I imagine that all you modern collectors will be quite pleased!

Hi everyone!
Well the wait for the second printing is over and the decks were finished yesterday. The final production numbers for the decks are as follows. Everyone that pledged here or did a pre-order in the Encarded store will be getting the second printing decks with the updated tuck boxes.
• Bronze: 2,202
• Silver: 2,340

campaign.story:
Our project may have ended, but your chance to buy our bread has not... go to www.SoberDough.com
Kickstarter Community Reviews
Five people claimed our $1 reward to receive a bag of SoberDough Brew Bread mix and become our official testers for the Kickstarter community. If you want to know the real deal on our bread click here to read - SoberDough Reviews from Kickstarter
"Craft beer has gained enormous popularity with breweries popping up all over the place. Now with SoberDough, combine your favorite craft beer with the SoberDough bread mix for amazing Artisan bread. Nom Nom!"-The Crowdfund Mafia
Bread + Beer: A Delicious History
People have been brewing and baking for thousands of years. The shared ingredients and storied history tie beer and bread together. It's only natural (and utterly delicious!) for the two to join together to make a bread worthy of kings and queens...
When we discovered the perfect blend of ingredients, it was evident we had created something special. Hands down, this is the best bread we have ever made. No baking skills are needed; with 5 minutes of work and less than an hour in the oven, out will come one of the most delicious loaves of bread you will ever eat. Ever. It’s Magical.
And for those that don't prefer beer or can't drink... it doesn’t have a heavy beer taste and all the alcohol evaporates out while baking. Plus, you can always substitute with a carbonated water like club soda. Try it and don’t blame us when you eat the whole loaf before you share! 

Handcrafted Flavors
100% All Natural Goodness
No shortcuts here. We are believers in using 100% all-natural ingredients. We do not use any preservatives, artificial flavors, or poor quality ingredients. Every ingredient we use, from the flour to the herbs and seasonings, are carefully picked for a healthy, wholesome taste. If we wouldn't eat it, we wouldn't want you too either!
Mom + Son: A Great Team
Long before the perfect loaf came out of the oven, it came out of the imagination of a mom and son during a casual conversation about life.
Jordan: "I was sharing my enthusiasm about the burgeoning craft beer industry here in Nashville and explained to my mom that beer and bread, to me, would be like wine and cheese was for her. Our conversation sparked an idea and she asked me, 'What if we could take your love for artisan beer and my love for baking and make something of it? Maybe a bread mix that is so easy and delicious, anyone would be able to make and enjoy homemade bread." I was so excited when she said this. I missed homemade meals and the war in the kitchen wasn't getting any easier. My mom, whom I admire for her creative ingenuity, started creating and perfecting the recipes as I poured in my knowledge of beer. Together, we mixed our two loves in a bowl and put it in an oven. Forty-five minutes later came delicious bread which we would later call SoberDough."
"The bread was good... real good. Friends would try it and rant about how amazing it was. Astounded by the process in which to make it, I would get texts from them asking for their own bag of mix. It was evident that this mix we made had potential to be more than our own secret recipe. I had a desire to start a business, so I went to my mom and discussed the possibility of teaming up to sell the bread mixes and here we are now."
Veronica: "I thought it was a perfect opportunity to teach my sons about business so I was game with the idea. Everyone now plays a role. Even my youngest, at 11, wanted his own job.
I've been baking for many years. I love experimenting and mixing flavors to find something that is totally unique and delicious. It's fun to share the ability to make brag worthy bread to others whether they can or can't bake. We handcraft each of our artisan brew bread mixes in small batches. Always made with all natural ingredients and lots of love."
Our goal for this project
We love what we are doing, and can't wait to share this fabulous bread with everyone! The funds will be used to order large quantities of ingredients to stock the kitchen for the first bulk run of bread mixes; for screenprinting our signature muslin bags; and fees for a commercial kitchen rental.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Unplanned challenges sometimes arise to delay the completion of a project, but we have a strategic plan in place to minimize any delays. We know exactly how long it takes to get the ingredients and make our bag. We have calculated the maximum time it would take to produce our bags is 2 weeks. The last unknown element will be the amount of the final orders and the labor needed to fill the orders. You will notice our rewards have limited quantities to each. We figured out how many mixes we are able to produce in order to satisfy our shipping dates. When a reward category is full, we will add another reward and adjust the shipping date for the next run of mixes accordingly. We do this to maintain the quality of your order and ensure you receive your pledge on time as promised... You gave us your trust and support and we will fulfill our responsibility to you. You are the fuel that drives us!

If you have a question, comment, or suggestion, we are only a message away. We look forward to hearing everything you have to say and you can expect us to respond quickly with our appreciation for taking the time to reach out to us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: These babies are ready to ship!
updates.update_content:
Hello All!
Well, it's the final count down! 72 hours and ticking!! We are only $1,299 away from $10,000. If we hit $10,000, everyone gets a printed cook book with recipes using SoberDough as appetizers, breakfast, entrees and more! I know we've got the best backers to help get us there!
BIG NEWS:

Today we are releasing t-shirts! It also happens to be my birthday! 
We had a lot of fun coming up with the sayings on the t-shirts so check them out... For my birthday, I've been giving gifts to the ones I care about and I have a gift for you all.. my beautiful mother gave me a journal for christmas and my cousin (whom I consider my little sister) did the same for my birthday. So to honor my mother, 6 months of writing, and 70 pages filled with 25,000 words, I'm posting a picture of my last submission in this chapter of my life.

We have officially released our stretch goals! We had a miscommunication earlier today with the green chile cheddar but those things happen. We apologize for the confusion and want to clarify who all is eligible for the add-on. Everyone, except testers, whom backed us from 6/21-6/24 (the day we reached our goal) can add on one bag of our green chile cheddar mix for 5 dollars. We hope that answers any questions, but if not, feel free to leave a comment and we will respond. Thanks and everyone have a good night!
Warmest regards,

As of 3 P.M. yesterday, and in a little over 72 hours since we launched, we are proud to announce we were 100% funded! We want to start by saying thank you to all of our backers. If we could shake your hand we would do that too. Your support and kind words have driven our project to be successfully funded with a month to go! When we launched our project we only dreamt of the possibility of what might be. One by one, you all have made that dream real to us and we are ecstatic at this opportunity! We've been asked a couple questions so we want to stay transparent and answer those for you.

Today was very eventful. We woke up early, finished baking a few more loaves, picked up some final materials, packed the car, and headed to our first event. We set up at a really cool music festival here in Nashville and 2 hours later we were ready to introduce the bread to some lucky Nashvillians. We had a blast talking to everyone, met some really awesome people, and Jordan finally had an audience for his corny jokes. Overall, it was an amazing experience and we couldn't have asked for a better launch. But with every great start, comes a twist. In this case, it was an unexpected 15 minute storm that was monsoon-esque. The wind picked up and 5 minutes later it was a heavy downpour with gusts that were trying to steal our tent (see us hold the fort down in the video) In the storm's defense, it did give us one awesome sunset! Though we were soaked, it was probably one of the funnest times we've had. We were greeted with even better news when we got back.. We are now over half way to our goal and are only 2 days in! I guess you could say we are off to a thunderous start! You all have given this project life and we're greatly appreciative of that. If you live in the Nashville area stay tuned to updates or check us out on twitter or facebook because we will be doing more events in the coming weeks (next time will be indoors!) Have a great night everybody and enjoy your Sunday Funday!

campaign.story:
1 FREE STICKER TO EVERY BACKER!*
*(Under Add-ons)
My project is about storytelling - it's about Alice's continued adventures in Wonderland to be precise. Fairy tales make for a great entertaining medium, and growing up I was fascinated by them. I want to take that same love and passion we all reminisce about and put them into a deck of playing cards - the cards that come from my vision of Wonderland. Inspired by Lewis Carroll's (Charles Dodgson) original Alice's Adventures in Wonderland, I wanted to take this classic story further, by continuing Alice's Adventures as a young lady who earns the title - "Alice of Wonderland". My deck of playing cards, as well as my main story, has a Steampunk Wonderland theme. I am keeping the traditional de la Rue design style by only illustrating the face cards and keeping the numbered cards basic, but with a hint of Wonderland.
Why Steampunk in Wonderland? The original Wonderland story was written and set in the late 1800's Victorian era. The genre of Steampunk derives from that same era so it ties in nicely with the Wonderland theme. However, my deck of Wonderland playing cards is part of a larger picture, one that tells the story of the continuing adventures of Alice. In this more mature setting, Alice is now a young lady and the world she remembers from Wonderland has changed, everything is now Steampunk - but still Wonderland. The 4 main kingdoms of Hearts, Clubs, Spades, and Diamonds, rule Wonderland. I am including Alice, the Hatter, the Cheshire Cat, and the White Rabbit as the Joker playing cards illustrated in full pose and in the same black and white line art as the royal face cards.
Music Credit: "Path to Victory" composed by Clarence Yapp

Rewards are limited to quantity of 10 items please!
1 FREE STICKER TO EVERY BACKER!

To add-on, you must already have pledged to any level. Then simply adjust your pledge amount to reflect the add-on. I will send a survey at the end of the project to collect information such as shirt sizes & signed or unsigned items. Just contact me if you have any questions or concerns. **LIMIT 10 items per reward**

T-shirt Designs
"The Hatter" is my first t-shirt design. These designs come in a single color and the entire art is hand-drawn. Every shirt ordered will be silk screened by hand on premium grade cotton-blend t-shirts. You can choose from any color on the chart. campaign.story:
We would like to thank everyone for helping us reach our original goal in such a short period of time! (& for helping us reach out stretch goal of $5,000! This means everyone who pledged $25 or more gets an extra small bag of CakeCrisps!! Woohoo!) Our next stretch goal is $10,000 and we'll be giving everyone who pledges $25+ an extra small dip (4 oz) and everyone who pledges $100+ an extra large dip (8oz)!
CakeCrisps are a new way to enjoy an old favorite! We bake our CakeCrisps from scratch with recipes we learned from our mom.
Featured On:
http://www.hlntv.com/article/2013/07/15/kickstarter-projects-treefort-five-cake-chips
http://blog.cookingchanneltv.com/2013/07/17/anti-theft-pint-glass-and-cakechips/
Our passion for cake began at a young age when we would help our mother bake cakes for everything from birthdays to holidays to family dinners. We learned to bake homemade cakes from our mom and to this day, we bake only from scratch.
CakeCrisps is a dessert we created when we were craving cake but didn't want to go through the hassle of making a whole cake which we would then have to fill, frost, cut, and serve. We wanted something simpler; something we could snack on without the need for all the extras an actual cake requires. CakeCrisps are shaped like chips for an easy snacking experience but they pack the full flavor of a bite of cake!
We have also created a range of dips to go along with your CakeCrisps. Currently, we offer homemade dulce de leche, guava, and pineapple dips.
With your help we would like to move into a commercial kitchen to expand our business and eventually build a larger kitchen here in the United States to produce CakeCrisps and allow us to share our creation with even more people!
We hope that you will donate to our project and help us make CakeCrisps the world's next big snack item!
What we need the funding for: 
Renting a commercial kitchen space in our area
Certifications
Ingredients (all of our products are made from scratch!)
Supplies (Containers, kitchen utensils)
Creating a website

We're ready to put in the work to make CakeCrisps a successful endeavor but we need your help to make it happen!
Thank you!
Serving size: 15 Crisps
Calories per serving: 50 
Grams of Fat per serving: 1.5
Small Bag: 1-2 servings
Large Bag: 8-10 servings
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We believe that starting small and staying within our means will allow us to solidly grow while avoiding many of the risks that opening a storefront or rushing into expansion would bring. We believe that our passion for our product is what will allow us to overcome obstacles and keep moving forward.

The one risk we felt we had with the project was our ability to ship in the summer which is why we will be shipping out rewards in November instead! We look forward to delivering delicious crisps & dips to our backers!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone!
We want to thank you all for the support you have given us through this whole process and just reiterate that we would not have been able to have this experience without all of you! It was such an amazing experience to be able to create a business and have all of you be so supportive and helpful throughout the entire process.
Unfortunately, we have decided to stop pursuing CakeCrisps further due to the fact that we no longer have the time or resources to continue to do so. When we first began this venture, we asked for the amount of money we thought was necessary based on different quotes we had researched for each service. Shipping, supplies, and ingredients ended up costing much more than we originally budgeted for and we ended up having to take money we had saved up ourselves in order to fulfill some orders. Our biggest obstacles were shipping, which was our biggest expense and what we had the biggest issue with since we had to send some orders out twice because they got lost in the mail. We were also unable to get ingredients in large enough quantities to get a significant discount, so we spent a lot of money on that as well. We also did not budget in the 10% Kickstarter takes from all funds raised, which significantly lowered the amount we had to work with.

Hi everyone!
We are very excited to announce that, as of today, we have sent out every pledge reward. If you have not yet received yours, it's on the way! We finished all $25 and $50 rewards about a week ago and sent out the last of the $10 rewards today. We are very sorry that it took this long. We were overwhelmed by all the support and we are so thankful to have such awesome and understanding backers!
Moving forward, we have decided to take a break until May to focus on our studies meaning that while we will be making connections and planning for the future, we won't be able to take orders until May. We are sorry to disappoint everyone. We really wanted to start at the beginning of February but ultimately decided that we would be too distracted between school and CakeCrisps and our on campus organizations. We hope you will support us when we come back full-force in May. We are so appreciative of all your support and really could not even begin to have built this company without all of you! We really want to thank every single one of you for believing in us and helping us fund our dream.

Hi everyone!
I know we promised everyone to get the CakeCrisps out by the New Year but this past week we had an emergency and Dajelyn had to stay in the hospital for 3 days. She's better now and we have resumed baking as usual. I tried to get as many orders out as I could make alone but we have not yet shipped a good amount of orders. We are really sorry to the people who have not yet received theirs. I assure you we are working nonstop on making sure all 276 pledge rewards are sent out.

Hi everyone,
We are really sorry about this but we won't be able to ship to everyone by Christmas. We got a good amount of orders out today but weren't able to finish them all by today which was the Christmas deadline. We are done with finals as of yesterday so we can dedicate ourselves full time to baking and completing the orders.
Again, we are very sorry to everyone looking forward to having them for Christmas ): We got pretty overwhelmed with school and running the CakeCrisp company and we apologize for not planning ahead as well as we should have.

Hi everyone!
Thank you again for all your support!
A few updates: -We have labels and have started putting them on our jars and bags (picture attached!)
-Our website's homepage is almost done (cakecrispco.com). Sorry the website has been taking a little long. We've been busy with school and midterms as well ):

Hey everyone!
We're really sorry about the lack of updates (again). We're going to try to post weekly/every two weeks from now until we start shipping (mid-late November).
Since our last update we have finished the forms we need to hand in to finish registering our business. We also came up with an awesome, new, simple logo. We would love your feedback on it! (Since we'll be printing labels in the coming week)

Hey Everyone!
We know it's been a while since we updated everyone. We've been really busy testing recipes, ordering supplies, and working on getting all our paperwork having to do with the company in order. We bought a website (cakecrispco.com) and are working on it's design and layout so right now it's empty. We'll update when it's done!
We just received a shipment of containers as well for the dips, which we're really excited about. We also decided on getting clear stand up pouches for the crisps instead of the foil bags we were considering.

Hey everyone! We forgot to add the question for the extra cake crisp bag flavor for everyone who pledged $25+ (since we reached our stretch goal!)
Please fill it out here (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1ObStl4QQNLllvJEZNWYknJ33ancpZBEfxsfpAGwM1SI/viewform) if you haven't!
Thank you and we apologize for the inconvenience!

campaign.story:
Thanks to all our backers! Missed the Kickstarter? You can still order a Range.
Everyone loves an artisan who can brew an excellent ale, smoke the perfect side of ribs, or make some amazing chocolate truffles. These culinary masters are what makes local restaurants great. But you don't have to devote your life to the craft in order to make better food. With Range, you can take the guesswork out of cooking and perfect your kitchen craft.
Clip it on or stick it in and set an alert for the desired temperature with the Range app for iOS (we include presets for common uses). While you run to the store or sip a well-deserved glass of wine, Range graphs the temperature over time so you can learn and improve from each experiment. Once the roast has reached temperature and achieved perfection, Range tells you. 
You already know how to use an iPhone — Range can help make kitchen craft just as easy. Soon, your homebrew will be the talk of the neighborhood. Better throw some meat in the smoker to feed all your newfound friends. Welcome to the internet of poultry. And candy, and chocolate, and beer...
Enter the quantified kitchen.
Correct temperature and time are critical to making so much good food (and drink). With recipe graphs, you'll be able to watch temperature over time, share and compare with past batches. Combined with temperature band templates for common kitchen activities like candymaking and meatmaking, you'll be able to see where your recipe went wrong or so very, very right.
The story
After talking to many of our Twine backers who cared about monitoring temperature, we realized that many of them made food and drink as both professionals and enthusiasts, and wanted to do it better. This struck a chord with those of us who love experimenting in the kitchen, or tinkering with old family recipes. We realized that we could make a useful kitchen tool for food makers who care about perfection.
There's nothing out there that feels as good as our other kitchen tools. We've seen a lot of creaky plastic gadgets and unimaginative apps. We wanted to design something that belongs in the jar with your other kitchen utensils. No batteries or wireless troubleshooting, and a durable silicone clip-on handle. Range is a tool, and tools disappear into the task.
Features
We've worked hard to miniaturize the electronic guts so that what you see looks deceptively simple. You’ll use Range to craft the perfect meal; we crafted Range to let you do just that. Range is simple to use, but rich in information when you want it; we designed the app and thermometers with your needs in mind.
Hardware
Aqua Range has a 6-inch rounded tip (when the handle is clipped onto something, that's a total of 8 inches). Designed for many tasks including candy making, beer brewing, and cheese making. (Planned retail price: $59) 
Ember Range has a 3-inch pointed tip. Ideal for cooking meat. (Planned retail price: $59)
Coal Range has a 3-inch pointed tip. Made with higher-temperature materials that make it ideal for heavy grill use.
Range (including the cable) is made of food-safe, eco-friendly, good-feeling, free-range silicone that can be handwashed and withstand temperatures up to 450ºF.
Thermometer reads from -40ºF to 450ºF (-40ºC to 230ºC), with 0.5ºF accuracy at 135ºF (about the temperature of a medium rare steak).
Designed to allow you to clip it onto the side of a pot or on a rack. Use your hands for cooking, not fussing with technology.
Plugs into the headphone jack of your iOS device for maximum reliability. A long cable keeps your device safely on the counter where you're using it for recipes.
Stretch goal achieved: All Ranges now have a 4.5-foot cable. Aqua and Ember have a thin silicone cable good to 450ºF, and Coal has a thicker extreme-temperature cable that can withstand bursts of direct flame.
Stretch goal achieved: Magnetically pin the cable onto any metal surface to keep it neat and out of the way. (Aqua and Ember only.)
Have an old iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch sitting in a drawer? Connect it to Range to send notifications to any iOS device with the Range app.
Software
Use with any iPhone, iPad or iPod touch on iOS 5.1 and newer (iPhone 3GS and newer, iPod touch 3rd generation and newer, any iPad). 
Send push notifications to any iOS device with the Range app.
Set alerts at multiple temperatures with a flick of your thumb. Get notified when temperatures rise or fall past your mark.
Use presets that have custom notification sounds. 
Switch to gourmet temperature recommendations for juicier results.
Use recipe graphs to see how the temperature changes over time.
Use Range-Finder templates to view temperature bands to target for meat, candy, and other classes of edible items.
Stretch goal achieved: Create your own Range-Finder templates for your favorite, finicky beer or chocolate recipe.
Save and share visual results as a counterpart to your recipes, and use them as a guide to get repeatable results the next time you recreate that beer recipe.
Can display temperatures in Fahrenheit or Celsius.

Pledge Levels
What we've done
As with any good recipe, our process gets better with every repetition. Range is the latest result of our recipe for making great products.
We've prepared for several production scenarios, and have picked and vetted most of our suppliers. As much of the work as possible is done locally in Texas and the US — not only because it's important to support our neighbors, but because it produces more reliable results, especially when demand grows but the schedule doesn't.
The video and images here show some of the work we've done so far. We have a solid design after many iterations of sketches as well as carved, printed, and cast prototypes. We've built and tested several prototypes of the electronics, making them smaller each time. And we've been building an iOS app that already looks at home in iOS 7 (we're just ahead of the curve like that).
What we do next
This Kickstarter will fund the remainder of our development, allow us to meet the minimum order quantities for parts, and help us secure equipment needed for production. Your Kickstarter pledges help us fund electronic components, the tooling and materials for injection molding the silicone parts, assembly, certifications, packaging, and shipping. The more funds we raise, the quicker we'll be able to make Range better.
Here's our timeline: 
We are finalizing the electronic and industrial design in August. 
In September, we'll be able to buy components in quantity as soon as we receive the funds, and we'll start beta testing and tooling for the parts. 
By October, we'll have hardware we can commit to production. 
By the end of November, we should have the first Ranges to assemble and test, and we'll start packaging and shipping this first batch in time for the holidays. 
After a breather to make perfect turkey and caramel for our families, we'll then be able to ramp up full production and fulfillment in the first months of 2014.
Making things doesn't always unfold so neatly, but we've built in some padding in case something happens (it always does).
If you like what we do and want to be part of it, contribute to our project with your dollars, word of mouth, and creative ideas. Let's get cooking!
About us
Supermechanical is making a new generation of everyday objects that connect people. You may remember us from Twine, a little square that's the easiest way to get your objects and environments talking on the Internet. Our work, started at the MIT Media Lab, has been featured on The Verge, Wired, Engadget, the Wall Street Journal, Fast Company, and Cool Hunting. We want to give soul to electronics, and make connections between us.
Music written and performed by Russ Bonsall, a brewer and a patriot.
We've done this before.
This is not just a pre-order! Kickstarter is not a store. Yes, you'll be among the first to get an original new product; but on Kickstarter, you're helping us finish the product as well. As both project creators and backers, we embrace the process with all its ups and downs. Big companies have the same challenges, but they don't open their doors to you until they're ready to sell — this is part of the fun with Kickstarter. Read this — we believe it. 
That said, we learned a lot about the challenges of building and shipping hardware from Twine, and we’ve put that knowledge to use with Range in everything from the design and development, to how we interact with you, our backers. This Kickstarter will feature even more communication, less naiveté, and an equal amount of passion.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every hardware product has a supply chain. Different companies may provide components, make custom parts, and assemble electronics. Each link in the chain can be a failure point — a part has to be redone because it's not up to our specifications, an overseas shipment gets delayed, etc.

We've already vetted and picked suppliers, many of whom we've worked with before. Most of them are in the US, which makes things faster and more reliable (and because we like to support our neighbors and keep a smaller carbon footprint). We’ve separated rewards into anticipated delivery dates based on production runs so that we’ll be able to get everyone their rewards when promised, even if we need to make more than expected.

In addition to the risks involved in making hardware, we'll be at the mercy of Apple for approval in the App Store.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi, backers! Haven't talked to you for a while here. Two things today.
Range app v1.6 update: Live temperature on any device
The biggest request we’ve had from Range owners is to view live temperatures from anywhere. You want to check that overnight brisket from bed, watch the caramel from your couch, or get updates on the turkey while you run errands.

updates.update_content:
Production and shipping update: 
A few days ago we got the last batch of Ranges back from our assemblers — that means if you haven’t gotten your Range yet (and aren’t in the EU) the wait is almost over. They’re currently at our distributors being packaged up and will be mailed out later this week. We’ll send out emails with shipping information when they are on the way.
EU Update:

Happy (early) Mother’s day to all Moms out there! My kitchen skills wouldn’t be nearly as good as they are today if I hadn’t grown up in the kitchen watching and helping my mom cook. If you cook your Mom up something nice for Mother’s Day with Range, we’d love to hear about it.
Version 1.2 of the Range app will be live in the app store later today — that means it's time to get excited about some new features.

updates.update_userinfo: Range app v1.2 — Rangefinders and an improved timer
updates.update_content:
Hacker backers, we’re looking for the best and most creative apps out there that use Range. Want to win internet fame and Supermechanical goodies? Now’s the time to develop an app using the latest version of the SDK — we’ll reward creativity, usability and looks.
The newest update to the SDK allows you to make a temperature-based iOS app as easily as you can make a webpage! Edit the included HTML template and click ‘Run’ in Xcode - no Objective C knowledge required, so you can use your Javascript and CSS skills to focus on a great interface. (Of course, if you’ve been looking for an excuse to use UIKit Dynamics, you can go native.) Hacker level backers can find a link to the SDK in their .

Did you know Range is designed and assembled entirely in the USA with 82.3% American parts? We’re proud to support our local community — read more about what goes into manufacturing Range in the USA here.

General shipping update:
We just received the next batch of 1500 Ranges from our assembler. Since these are the first Ranges made entirely by them, we’ll be testing them to make sure they look and work as good as we expect. (A benefit of manufacturing locally is that it's easy to do this.) Assuming everything checks out, we’ll be handing the Ranges off to our fulfillment center first thing next week to ship them out, with future batches of 1500 to follow every 3 weeks.

campaign.story:
Please visit www.crosskix.com for NEWS and UPDATES 
We are currently working on other crowdfunding campaigns as well as a NEW outsole technology that we hope to launch in Fall 2013.
_________________________________________________________________
FREE MINI-CINCH BAG with every purchase of CROSSKIX!  
Thank you backers! As a small gesture for your support, we'd like to give a FREE Mini-Cinch bag for every pair of Crosskix purchased!
_________________________________________________________________
                STRETCH GOALS
_______________________________________
What NEW colorways will be available?
Please scroll down to view the STRETCH GOAL available colorways.
How will the colorways be selected?
At the end of the campaign, we will send out an email survey requesting  your choice of STRETCH GOAL colorway(s). We will then tabulate all submissions and send out an ORDER SURVEY which will include the color choices available.
_________________________________________________________________
Thank you for returning!
For those returning from the original launch, THANK YOU for being patient and understanding! For new viewers, we experienced some compliance issues with Kickstarter and lost VALUABLE time due to being "locked out" of Kickstarter for approximately 48+ hours. (for more details on lock-out please click here http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/crosskix/crosskix-hybrid-footwear/posts). Update #8
At any rate, we are determined to bring CROSSKIX to market and have offered MUCH more attractive rewards in hopes to exceed our goal and offer some very NICE stretch goals! 
Why did we reduce or goal?
Since the original launch, we've had some interested investors inquire about investment opportunities. So, we've negotiated a deal that allowed us to reduce the goal. BUT, the deal is contingent upon us reaching our goal in order for investment funds to be made available. 
CROSSKIX is a Registered Trademark of Crosskix, Inc. (patent pending)
________________________________________________________ _____
Media coverage.
PSFK: http://www.psfk.com/2013/04/crocs-running-shoe.html
WSJ - (WALL STREET JOURNAL) http://online.wsj.com/article/PR-CO-20130416-910519.html?mod=googlenews_wsj
the OREGONIAN: http://www.oregonlive.com/playbooks-profits/index.ssf/2013/04/new_portland-based_footwear_br.html
TECH DEER. http://www.techdeer.com/web/crosskix-the-new-hybrid-footwear/
CONCEPT KICKS: https://www.facebook.com/ConceptKicks
MAN OF MANY:  http://manofmany.com/lifestyle/crosskix/
TRND Nation: http://trndnation.com/crosskix-hybrid-recycle-with-style/
_____________________________________________________________
What is CROSSKIX?
A Hybrid Footwear for multiple uses. It is by far the most technical shoe in the EVA footwear category. "CROSS" is the short term for "crossover" and "KIX" is for "kicks" which is slang for shoes (a term typically used by young adults).
CHOOSE FROM 6 STOCK COLORS:
_________________________________________
STRETCH GOAL COLORWAYS BELOW.
STRETCH GOAL COLORWAYS.
The above STRETCH GOAL colorways will be available for VOTING at end of campaign. 
Every backer will receive an email requesting their VOTE for their favorite colorway.
Each STRETCH GOAL reached will allow for ONE colorway that will be ADDED to the STOCK colorway options. 
For example: if we reach at least $70,000 (Stretch Goal #2), the TOP 2 vote getters will be added to the STOCK colorways.
An email survey requesting your color(s) and size(s) will be sent at end of campaign for order processing.
________________________________________________________________
Our Story.
Let's face it....there is really ONLY one brand out there that dominates the EVA (soft foam composite) footwear category (as you have seen in the video). We all know who that is. But if you're like MANY other folks, you've probably have said to yourself..."they're comfortable, but I wouldn't be caught with them on!"
So, our goal was to design a shoe that EVERYONE can PROUDLY wear for multiple uses and of course...look GOOD while doing it. We believe there's definitely a void in this category for a more sportier, stylish, and functional shoe. So, we've spent over 4 years designing, redesigning, testing, retesting, producing sample after sample and have finally come up with a shoe that all men, women, and kids just can't wait to get their feet into. Our focus groups have unanimously voted on what you see.
We're committed to producing top quality footwear for the demanding consumer that cares about price, style, and functionality. We let YOU decide what you want in a multi-purpose athletic shoe. 
What makes CROSSKIX different from the competition?
Below is a chart showing the advantages of CROSSKIX as compared to the one brand that dominates this category. We wanted to fill the void in this category for a more Sportier shoe that can be used in so many more ways than just a slip-on. Please review below.
Special Air/Water Drain holes.
Crosskix have strategically placed Air & Water Drain holes that allow air to circulate through the rear of the shoe for added ventilation. It also acts as a drain hole when used in water conditions i.e. washing your car or walking on the beach or pool.
_______________________________________
Why CROSSKIX?
multiple uses - leisure, recreation, casual, and work
stylish AIR VENTS throughout to keep your feet cool & dry
soft and contour footbed for a comfortable fit
strategically located water vents for use IN and OUT of the water
PRE and POST foot recovery features (after playing sports)
EASY cleaning
100% RECYCLABLE - for playgrounds, track & field, basketball courts, etc.
fashion forward styling


Unlike other foam composite shoes, CROSSKIX are made with separate components allowing for greater flexibility and a "real" shoe feel.

________________________________________________________________
MINI-CINCH BAG - 14" x 18" tall w/ 9" zipper pocket on back side (for wallet, keys, cell phone, mp3 player, etc.)
________________________________________________________________
Accessorize your Crosskix with magnetic CROSSBITS. We're working on our first run of icons and hope to have them before the end of this campaign. 
These are a few styles of CROSSBITS that we will be offering. CROSSBITS are optional for each pair. Each new pair of Crosskix will come with a standard Crosskix logo (as shown in above images). Please stay tuned for more info as the campaign continues.
_______________________________________________________________
Our 5 YEAR GUARANTEE!
We are very confident about our quality that if any part of your CROSSKIX becomes defective under normal use (i.e. instep strap breaks off, separation between upper, outsole, and sidestrap), we will gladly replace it with a NEW pair! Simply follow our return policy procedure by sending us a clear image of the defective area and we will send you an authorization code. Normal wear and tear does not qualify.
What do we do with returned shoes?
EVA material type shoes typically will last forever (under normal worn conditions). Anything that is defective on CROSSKIX can easily be repaired and/or replaced. So, we will actually take all returned shoes (that are still in good condition) repair them and donate them to needy kids and families around the world. We are VERY passionate about giving back and are very excited when we have collected enough shoes to make our first donation!
_______________________________________________________________
100% RECYCLABLE (RecyKIX Program)
Don't throw away your used or unwanted CROSSKIX! 
CROSSKIX are 100% recyclable!

Return 'em to us and we'll use for our RECY-KIX program. In return, we'll offer a 15% DISCOUNT on your next pair of CROSSKIX!
_______________________________________________________________
Do we know what we're doing?
Experience.
Absolutely! We have been in the athletic apparel industry over 10 years and in footwear for over 4. Collectively, our team has over 30 years in footwear design and manufacturing. During the 4 years, we've actually developed 3 other designs and samples. All of which did not make the cut for design but more importantly - functionality. 
Quality.
Our commitment is our promise to deliver a high quality functional product. We've studied the competition, improved the flaws, designed based on demand, and all the while maintaining an attractive style.
About the shoe.
Crosskix are made with the highest EVA (ethylene vinyl acetate) material. It is basically a soft foam composite that is commonly used as midsoles in running and basketball shoes. Most people can identify the material simply by the brand crocs (we prefer not to be mentioned in the same breath simply because CROSSKIX are much more superior in the way it is constructed, function and quality).
They are VERY lightweight (only 7.5oz for size 11). The outsole and uppers are SEPARATE molds (not like the competition that is made with just ONE mold). This allows the shoe greater flexibility and to wear like a fabric made shoe.
What will the funding be used for?
Size Molds. In order to produce the shoes, we need to pay for the molds (sizes 3-13) so that we can begin production for our opening order. We have everything in place with our manufacturer and now just need the funding to produce molds. If we exceed $100,000, we will be able to offer childrens sizes as well. 
What sizes do we offer?
Sizes 3-13 (including WOMENS). (click here to view size chart)
All colorways are in FULL sizes (no half sizes needed).
What if I order the wrong size?
NO PROBLEM! We understand this may be a huge concern for you. You (our backers & customers) are our MOST VALUABLE asset in our business! Without you, we wouldn't have a business. So, we want to make sure that you have the most pleasurable experience when you shop for CROSSKIX. 
We will take back any pair of UNWORN Crosskix and gladly replace them with the size/color of your choice. Return postage is on us. We will have DC's (distribution centers) in US and Canada and you can return your Crosskix to either DC. All other countries, will need to pay for return shipping (sorry, this can be VERY expensive for us).
click here to view SIZE CHART
If you have ordered the wrong size, no worries! We have an EASY NO HASSLE exchange program. We want to make sure you get the RIGHT size as fast as possible!
Upon funding, we will post a "HOW TO ORDER THE RIGHT SIZE" page on our website so you can order the right size the first time.
_______________________________________
Custom COLOR PALLETTE.
Select from above color palette to create your own CUSTOM Crosskix!
________________________________________________________________
How do I make a pledge or purchase?
